snippet: The deal struck by Congress raised taxes on a handful of the highest-earning Americans, with about 99.3 percent of households experiencing no change in their income taxes.
abstract: United States tax code may now be the most progressive it has been since 1979, following last-minute fiscal deal that raised rates on the highest-earning Americans; average family in the top 1 percent will pay federal tax rate of more than 36 percent in 2013, up from 28 percent in 2008.
lead_paragraph: The deal struck by Congress raised taxes on a handful of the highest-earning Americans, with about 99.3 percent of households experiencing no change in their income taxes.

headline.seo: After Fiscal Deal, Tax Code May Be Most Progressive Since 1979
headline.main: Tax Code May Be the Most Progressive Since 1979
headline.print_headline: After Fiscal Deal, Tax Code May Be the Most Progressive Since 1979
